title: internal/signals/signals.go
subtitle: Signal Handler - OS Signal Management
description:
Note: The signal handler manages OS signals for graceful application shutdown. The Handle() method is designed to run as a goroutine and blocks until either a signal is received or the context is cancelled.

Monitored Signals

  • • syscall.SIGTERM (15): Termination signal
  • • syscall.SIGINT (2): Interrupt (Ctrl+C)
  • • syscall.SIGHUP (1): Hangup detected

Handler Logic

  • • Creates buffered channel (size 1) for signals
  • • Registers signals with signal.Notify
  • • Uses select to multiplex between context and signals
  • • Executes shutdown callback only on signal receipt

Entry Point: The Handle() method is called as a goroutine from app.Run() with a context and shutdown callback function.
author: A.M.Hamidipour
